author: Cape Cod Times sports@capecodonline.com
title: Sinha paces Dolphins past Lions
text: Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 10:09 PM By Cape Cod Times Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 10:09 PM » Social News Cape Cod Times sports@capecodonline.com SOUTH YARMOUTH - Sophomore KC Sinha had two goals and assisted two more to lead the Dennis-Yarmouth Dolphins boys soccer team past the St. John Paul II Lions, 4-0, on Monday morning. Sinha found junior Chris Basili with a cross just 6:32 into the match, with the junior heading it home for the only goal senior Ryan Giffee would need. Giffee earned the shutout in net for Dennis-Yarmouth (5-6-1), making a couple of key saves for the Dolphins, including tipping a hard shot ball over the crossbar. Sinha doubled the lead 16:51 into the game, picking off the ball, running down the right side of the field and knocking the ball home for a 2-0 lead. Sinha added a similar run early in the second half, blasting in a goal from 25-yards out for a 3-0 lead 7:14 after the break. Sophomore Andrew Fagundes was the beneficiary of Sinha’s second assist, scoring with under a minute to play for the 4-0 final. Senior Max Parent and senior Hans FanFan helped D-Y control the midfield while Giffee got strong support in the back from junior sweeper Braedy Leidner. Martha’s Vineyard 4, Barnstable 1: Vineyard senior Jason Lages netted four goals to lead the Vineyard to victory in Hyannis, becoming the first MV player to reach the 100 point mark. Mike Power also scored for Martha’s Vineyard (7-3-1), which led 2-0 at the half. The Vineyarders also got strong play in the midfield from Nevin Wallis. Lages has 76 goals and 24 assists through 51 varsity games, including 21 goals this season. Barnstable is 2-10. Upper Cape 7, Avon 1: Curran Baker and Tyler Todescoled five Rams in scoring with two goals each in a win over the Panthers in Bourne. Justin Davis, Thomas Willett and Luke Still added goals to help Upper Cape improve to 7-2-3. The Rams got strong play from Mike Kinsman and Ben Cardoso, who added an assist each, as well as Cory Sullivan, who had two assists. Sandwich 2, Hingham 1: The Blue Knights struck quickly in their non-conference game against Hingham on Monday morning at Sandwich. Ryan Beaton scored in the fifth minute and the junior then assisted on Dylan DeBettencourt's goal in the 24th minute. "We wanted a quick start. We came out with a lot of energy," said Sandwich coach Alfredo Alvarenga. "Our ball movement was very good in the first half." Hingham's only goal came on a penalty kick by Grayson Presotti with 12 minutes left in the game. The win improved Sandwich's record to 4-6. By Cape Cod Times
